intro: Hieracium croaticum, commonly known as Croatian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in Croatia and surrounding regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium croaticum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinators.
